definition: twenty (20), in a limited number of set expressions/also written using banker's character 念
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult

sentences.english: Simple cysts are difficult to distinguish from arachnoid cyst or epidermoid.
sentences.chinese: 單純的囊腫較難與蛛網膜囊腫和表皮樣囊腫相鑑別。

sentences.english: But this is still difficult to prove.
sentences.chinese: 但是這仍然是很難證明的。

sentences.english: Wasn't it quite tough to get into that course in UCLA?
sentences.chinese: 能進到UCLA學這門課很難吧？
雨後的道路變得十分難走。

sentences.english: This paper tries to explore the application of fine powder technology to Chinese medicinal herbs and insoluble medicines.
sentences.chinese: 本文就難溶藥物與中草藥微細化技術作出探索性研究。

sentences.english: Culture is a difficult concept to pin down.
sentences.chinese: 文化是一個非常難講清楚的概念。

sentences.english: A secure, memorable password is easy for you to remember, and hard for others to guess.
sentences.chinese: 安全可靠又難以遺忘的密碼應該是易記且難猜的。

sentences.english: Sometimes trying to find something on the worldwide web is like trying to find a needle in a haystack.
sentences.chinese: 有時候在互聯網上找東西就和大海撈針一樣難。

sentences.english: You may have heard that some foods, because they are difficult to digest, will make you lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 你一定聽說過那些難消化所以會使你體重減輕的食品。

sentences.english: The only guy who was hard to get to know was Richie Gaspari.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的傢伙誰是很難了解的是裏奇斯帕裏。

sentences.english: Buckle up, it may harder for aliens to suck you out of your car.
sentences.chinese: 繫好安全帶，這樣外形人也更難把你從車子裏抓走。

sentences.english: Those who haven't prepared themselves to be creative rarely are.
sentences.chinese: 而那些沒有準備好做什麼的人很難有所創造。

sentences.english: A:I will try my best to make a good impression, but it is always easier said that done.
sentences.chinese: 我會盡最大努力留下好印象，可是說來容易做時難。

sentences.english: Indemnificatory housing difficultly on difficultly in sources of fund.
sentences.chinese: 保障性住房難就難在資金來源。

sentences.english: No matter how difficult English may be, you should do your best to learn it.
sentences.chinese: 不管英語有多麼難，你都應該盡你最大的努力來學它。

sentences.english: Given those variations, tsunami experts warned that predicting wave heights was difficult.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到這些變量，海嘯專家們說浪高會很難預測。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
this/this kind of/this sort of/this type of
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
